videos.title: History of Virtual Reality for Kids | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Step into the world of virtual reality—just for kids! In this video, we explore the fascinating history of VR and how it evolved from early experiments in the 1960s to the interactive experiences kids can enjoy today. From the first headsets and arcade machines to modern-day VR games and learning tools, you’ll discover how virtual reality has grown into a fun and educational experience for young explorers. We’ll also look at how VR is used in classrooms, museums, and even outer space training! Whether you’re curious about how it all started or where it’s going next, this video is your kid-friendly guide to the world of virtual reality.

#VirtualReality #KidsTech #HistoryOfVR #EducationalVideo #VRForKids #TechHistory #STEMforkids

videos.title: The Red Sea: Brief History and Facts | History Made Easy
videos.description:
What makes the Red Sea so important in history and science? In this video, we dive into the story of the Red Sea—from ancient trade routes and biblical connections to its unique geography and marine life. Learn how it played a major role in the rise of powerful civilizations, including Egypt and Arabia, and why it's still a key waterway today. We'll also explore the Red Sea's incredible coral reefs, its connection to tectonic plates, and a few surprising facts you might not know. Perfect for middle schoolers curious about how geography and history connect!

videos.title: Mummies of Egypt for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Why did the ancient Egyptians make mummies? In this video, we take a look at the fascinating process of mummification and the beliefs behind it. Learn how bodies were preserved, what items were buried with them, and why the journey to the afterlife mattered so much. Discover what mummies teach us about ancient Egyptian life, religion, and science. A great intro for curious kids who want to explore history’s mysteries!

videos.title: Golden Gate Bridge for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
How was the Golden Gate Bridge built—and why is it so famous? This video takes kids on a journey through the history and engineering of one of the world’s most iconic bridges. Learn how workers overcame fog, wind, and huge challenges to build this bright orange wonder that connects San Francisco to the rest of California.

videos.title: Cyrus the Great for Kids | Persian Empire | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Who was Cyrus the Great, and why is he remembered thousands of years later? This video introduces kids to the founder of the Persian Empire, known for his fairness, smart leadership, and a famous ancient document some call the first human rights charter. Learn how Cyrus built one of history’s greatest empires—and how his ideas still inspire people today.

videos.description:
Discover the amazing story behind the Brooklyn Bridge! This video breaks down how one of the oldest suspension bridges in the U.S. was built, who designed it, and what made it so important. Kids will learn about teamwork, innovation, and a few fun facts about life in New York over 140 years ago.

videos.title: Confucius for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Meet Confucius, one of the most influential thinkers in history! In this video, kids will discover who he was, what he taught, and why his ideas about kindness, respect, and family have lasted for over 2,000 years. We’ll explore where he lived, what problems he tried to solve, and how his teachings shaped entire countries.

videos.title: World War I for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
What was World War I, and why did it change the world? In this video, we explain the key events, causes, and impact of World War I in a simple and engaging way for students and curious viewers. Learn about the assassination that sparked the war, the countries involved, trench warfare, and how the war finally came to an end. We also explore how WWI shaped the modern world and set the stage for future conflicts. Great for classroom use or anyone wanting a quick, clear overview of this major historical event.

Ellis Island for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Come along as we explore Ellis Island, a place where millions of people first arrived in America long ago. In this video, you’ll learn what Ellis Island was, why it was important, and what it was like for the families who passed through its doors. We’ll take a look inside the old buildings, see where people were checked by doctors, and find out what questions they were asked. You'll hear stories of kids just like you who came from far away, hoping for a better life in a new country. 

Imagine leaving everything behind and stepping into a brand-new world! Ellis Island was a place full of hope, dreams, and sometimes even fear. But for many, it was the first step toward a new beginning. Let’s discover why Ellis Island is such an important part of America’s story and what it meant to the people who passed through it.

videos.title: Iwo Jima for Kids | World War 2 | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Let’s learn about the Battle of Iwo Jima, one of the most important battles in World War II. This small island in the Pacific Ocean became a key location for American forces fighting the Japanese army in 1945. In this video, you’ll discover how U.S. Marines landed on the beaches, faced tough resistance, and worked together to capture the island. We’ll talk about Mount Suribachi, where the famous flag-raising photo was taken—a powerful symbol of hope and victory. Learn how the Battle of Iwo Jima showed bravery, sacrifice, and helped bring World War II closer to an end.

videos.title: The Nile River for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Join us as we explore the Nile River, the longest river in the world and one of the most important parts of ancient Egyptian civilization. In this video, you’ll learn how the Nile flows through Africa, including countries like Egypt and Sudan, and why it was so important for farming, transportation, and daily life. We’ll look at how the Nile flooded every year, leaving behind rich soil that helped crops grow. You’ll also hear about pyramids, pharaohs, and how the Nile shaped ancient Egypt’s culture and religion. Discover why the Nile River is still so important today for millions of people.

videos.title: Blackbeard the Pirate for Kids | Edward Teach | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Set sail to learn about Blackbeard, one of the most feared pirates in history! His real name was Edward Teach, and he sailed the Atlantic Ocean and the Caribbean Sea in the early 1700s during the Golden Age of Piracy. In this video, you’ll discover how Blackbeard became famous for his scary look, with burning fuses in his beard, and his ship, the Queen Anne’s Revenge. Learn about pirate treasure, naval battles, and life at sea. We’ll also talk about how Blackbeard’s reign ended off the coast of North Carolina. Discover the real story behind this legendary pirate.

videos.title: Quirky bathroom in Gilbert AZ. Joes Farm Frill
Salem Witch Trials | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Step back in time to the year 1692 and discover the story of the Salem witch trials, one of the most dramatic events in colonial American history. In this video, you'll learn how fear, superstition, and religious beliefs led to a series of trials in Salem, Massachusetts, where more than 200 people were accused of practicing witchcraft. 

We’ll explore what daily life was like in Puritan New England, how the first accusations began, and why the community turned against its own neighbors. You’ll hear about the courtroom trials, the use of “spectral evidence,” and how panic spread. Find out what finally brought the hysteria to an end and why the Salem witch trials still matter today as a warning about fear and injustice.

videos.title: Cancun Mexico for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Travel back in time to discover the history of Cancun, Mexico! Long before it became a popular beach destination, this area was home to the ancient Maya civilization. In this episode, we’ll learn about the Maya people, their amazing stone temples, and the cities they built nearby. 

We’ll also explore how Cancun changed over time—from quiet jungle land to a world-famous tourist spot. Find out how the past and present come together in Cancun, and why this part of Mexico is so important in both history and culture. Get ready for a journey through time in sunny Cancun!

videos.title: Tulum Ruins for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Let’s travel to the ancient city of Tulum, on the coast of Mexico! Long ago, the Maya people built this city on a cliff overlooking the sea. In this episode, we’ll explore Tulum’s stone walls, pyramids, and watchtowers, and learn how it was once a busy trading port. We’ll discover how the Maya used the stars, made calendars, and protected their city. Tulum is one of the last cities the Maya built before Spanish explorers arrived. Come see how history lives on in this beautiful place by the sea!

videos.title: Roman Legions for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
March with the mighty Roman legionaries! In this episode, we’ll learn how these strong soldiers helped build and protect the Roman Empire. Wearing armor and carrying shields, they marched in lines, built roads, and fought in famous battles. We’ll explore what they ate, how they trained, and what daily life was like for a Roman soldier. Come discover how the Roman army became one of the most powerful forces in history—and what it meant to be a part of it.

videos.title: Yosemite National Park for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Yosemite is one of America’s most beautiful national parks—but it also has a rich history! In this episode, we’ll learn about the Native American tribes who lived in the Yosemite Valley for thousands of years. 

We’ll also discover how explorers and early park protectors helped save the land from being destroyed. From giant sequoia trees to powerful waterfalls, Yosemite has inspired artists, hikers, and nature lovers for over a hundred years. Come hear the story of how this wild and wonderful place became a national treasure.

videos.title: Wild West for Kids | American Frontier | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Saddle up! In this episode, we head to the American West during the 1800s, when pioneers traveled across the plains in wagons, looking for new land. We’ll learn what life was like on the frontier—what people ate, how they built homes, and the challenges they faced. 

We’ll also explore how this time changed the land and affected Native American tribes. From cowboys to gold rush towns, the frontier was full of excitement, danger, and big dreams. Come along on this wild journey through America’s early West!

videos.title: The Story of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Let’s step onto the mat and explore the history of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu! This style of martial arts began in Japan and was later developed in Brazil by the Gracie family. In this episode, we’ll learn how it grew into a popular sport known around the world. 

You’ll find out how Brazilian Jiu Jitsu focuses on grappling, balance, and using technique over strength—perfect for smaller fighters. From self-defense to championship matches, this martial art is full of exciting history and smart moves!

videos.title: Gods of Egypt for Kids | Ancient Egypt | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Let’s meet the powerful gods of ancient Egypt! These gods were part of everyday life for the Egyptians. In this episode, we’ll learn about Ra, the sun god who sailed across the sky, and Osiris, the ruler of the afterlife. We’ll meet Anubis, with the head of a jackal, who watched over the dead, and Horus, the falcon-headed god of kings. Each god had special powers and stories that helped explain the world around them—like how the sun rose, why the Nile flooded, and what happened after death. Through statues, temples, and hieroglyphs, the Egyptians showed their love and respect for their gods. Come explore a world filled with magic, mystery, and some of the most famous gods in history.

videos.title: Pharaohs of Egypt for Kids | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Pharaohs were the kings and queens of ancient Egypt—and they ruled like gods! In this episode, we’ll learn what life was like for a pharaoh, from wearing crowns to leading armies. Some pharaohs, like Ramses the Great, built huge temples and statues, while others, like Tutankhamun, are known for the treasures found in their tombs. We’ll explore how pharaohs made laws, honored the gods, and were buried in pyramids or hidden valleys. Being a pharaoh meant power, but also great responsibility. Come learn about these amazing rulers who helped shape one of the most fascinating civilizations in history!

videos.title: Goddesses of Egypt for Kids | Ancient Egypt | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Now it’s time to meet the amazing goddesses of ancient Egypt! In this episode, we’ll learn about Isis, the loving mother and magical healer, and Hathor, the goddess of joy, music, and dancing. There’s also Bastet, the cat goddess who protected homes, and Nut, the sky goddess who stretched above the earth. These powerful goddesses helped with everything from farming and family to war and wisdom. Egyptians believed goddesses had great strength and could bring both protection and punishment. Their stories were told in temples and written in hieroglyphs for thousands of years. Come discover how these mighty women shaped the world of ancient Egypt and inspired people across the ages.

videos.title: Book of the Dead for Kids | Ancient Egypt | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Let’s open the pages of the Book of the Dead—an ancient Egyptian guide to the afterlife! This book wasn’t a single story, but a collection of magical spells, prayers, and pictures. Egyptians believed it helped their spirits safely travel through the underworld after they died. In this episode, we’ll explore how the book was written on scrolls, placed in tombs, and filled with powerful symbols. We’ll meet gods and monsters from the afterlife, and learn what the ancient Egyptians believed happened after death. It’s like a roadmap for the soul, filled with strange creatures, tests of the heart, and a hope for eternal life. Come explore one of the most fascinating books in ancient history!

videos.title: The Great Sphinx of Giza for Kids | Ancient Egypt | Bedtime History
videos.description:
The Great Sphinx is one of the most mysterious monuments in the world! Located in Egypt near the pyramids of Giza, the Sphinx has the body of a lion and the face of a man. In this episode, we’ll explore when and why the Sphinx was built, and what it might have meant to the ancient Egyptians. Some think it protected sacred places or represented a powerful pharaoh. We’ll also learn how time, sand, and weather have changed the Sphinx, and how people today are working to protect it. With its huge size and puzzling history, the Great Sphinx has amazed visitors for thousands of years—and it still keeps many of its secrets hidden in the desert sands

videos.title: Spartan Army for Kids | Ancient Greece | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Get ready for battle with the Spartan army! In this episode, we’ll learn about the tough warriors from the ancient Greek city of Sparta. Spartan boys began training for war at a young age and lived a life of discipline and strength. Their army was small but powerful, known for its tight formations and brave fighters. We’ll explore how Spartans lived, what they wore, and what made their soldiers so feared in ancient times. But life in Sparta wasn’t just about fighting—it was also about teamwork, sacrifice, and loyalty to the city. Join us as we dive into the history of one of the most famous warrior societies the world has ever known.

videos.title: Alexander the Great for Kids | Ancient Greece | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Meet Alexander the Great, one of the most famous leaders in history! Born in ancient Macedonia, Alexander became king at just 20 years old. In this episode, we’ll learn how he led his army across Europe, Egypt, and Asia, creating one of the largest empires the world had ever seen. Alexander never lost a battle, and people admired his bravery and clever strategies. Along the way, he spread Greek ideas, built cities, and met new cultures. But his journey wasn’t easy, and it ended much too soon. We’ll explore how he became known as “the Great,” and how his actions changed history forever. Get ready to march with a young leader whose name is still remembered thousands of years later.

videos.title: Aztec Adventure: Journey to Tenochtitlán | History Stories for Kids
videos.description:
In this episode, journey with the fictional Chantico and her family of Aztec merchants as they travel through the wilds of ancient Mexico to the bustling metropolis of Tenochtitlán.

Along the way, they travel through busy markets, trade goods like cacao and feathers, and meet people from different parts of the Aztec Empire. As they reach the city, they marvel at the temples, canals, and the grand palace of the emperor. This tale brings the sights, sounds, and culture of the Aztecs to life, helping you imagine what it was like to live and trade in one of the most powerful cities of the ancient world.

videos.title: Amina's Quest: A Bedouin Story | History Stories for Kids
videos.description:
Join Amina, a young Bedouin girl, as she embarks on a perilous journey through the vast and unforgiving desert in search of water, the most precious treasure. Discover the essence of Bedouin life and their intimate ties with the desert but also highlights the critical challenges faced by indigenous peoples. Through Amina’s eyes, witness the beauty and brutality of desert life, the resilience of her people, and the relentless pursuit of life’s essentials in one of the earth’s most extreme environments.

videos.title: Egyptian Hieroglyphs for Kids | Ancient Egypt | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Step into the world of ancient Egypt and discover the secrets of hieroglyphics! In this video, you’ll learn how the Egyptians used pictures instead of letters to write words and tell stories. We’ll explore how scribes carved these symbols into stone or painted them on papyrus scrolls. You’ll see what some of the symbols mean and how people today figured out how to read them. Hieroglyphics weren’t just writing—they were also art, used in temples, tombs, and even magic spells. Come uncover the mysteries of this beautiful writing system and see how it helped keep Egypt’s history alive for thousands of years!

videos.title: Aztec Empire for Kids | Tenochtitlán | Bedtime History
videos.description:
Step into the world of the Aztecs, one of the greatest civilizations of ancient Mexico! The Aztecs built their capital city, Tenochtitlán, on a lake and filled it with temples, canals, and marketplaces. In this episode, we’ll learn how the Aztecs lived, farmed, traded, and worshipped powerful gods. We’ll explore their amazing calendar, chocolate drinks, and famous warriors. The Aztecs believed in strong leaders and often held large ceremonies to honor the gods. But their story also includes battles, alliances, and the arrival of Spanish explorers that changed everything. Come discover the rise and fall of this powerful and creative civilization—and how parts of their culture still live on today in modern Mexico.

videos.title: Ellis Island: An Immigrant's Story | History Stories for Kids
videos.description:
In this historical fiction story, journey with Maeve O'Donnell, a young girl from Ireland, as she and her family seek a fresh start in America. Follow their trials and triumphs, as they navigate their way through the bustling halls of Ellis Island and into the heart of a new world.

Maeve's story is one of resilience and hope as she leaves behind the familiar green hills of Ireland for the promise of opportunity in America. Join Maeve on her inspiring journey and discover the enduring spirit of those who helped shape the nation's history.

videos.title: Battle of Midway
videos.description:
In this episode, we dive into the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Just months after the attack on Pearl Harbor, the U.S. Navy faced off against Japan in a fierce sea and air battle. You’ll learn how clever planning and brave pilots helped the Americans win a key victory in the Pacific Ocean. It’s a story of courage, strategy, and how one battle helped change the course of the war.

videos.title: Russian Revolution | Lenin & The Bolsheviks | History Made Easy
videos.description:
In this episode, we’ll explore the Russian Revolution—a time when people in Russia rose up to change their country. You’ll learn why many were unhappy with the king, or czar, and how workers and soldiers demanded a new way of life. We’ll meet important leaders like Lenin and find out how the revolution led to big changes, including the beginning of the Soviet Union. It’s a powerful story of protests, change, and a country starting over.

videos.title: Babylonian Empire for Kids | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Travel back to ancient Mesopotamia and discover the mighty Babylonian Empire! In this episode, you’ll learn about King Hammurabi, who created one of the world’s first written law codes. We’ll explore the city of Babylon, with its towering ziggurats and famous Hanging Gardens. The Babylonians made important discoveries in math, science, and writing. Come find out how this powerful empire helped shape the ancient world.

videos.title: The Space Race for Kids | Apollo 11 | History Made Easy
videos.description:
Get ready for liftoff! In this episode, we explore the Space Race between the United States and the Soviet Union during the Cold War. You’ll learn how both countries rushed to send rockets, satellites, and people into space. From the launch of Sputnik to the first moon landing, this race was full of exciting discoveries and big dreams. Come find out how space exploration began and why it mattered to the whole world.

Find the Podcast wherever you like to listen!

Bedtime History is a podcast and video series with the goal of teaching historical stories and legends in a kid-friendly way. Stay tuned to hear many more stories covering historical figures and events from our past!
